item.title: Introduction
item.description: Fermat’s Factorisation Method linkFermat’s factorization is an algorithm for factoring integers that is based on Fermat’s Little Theorem. The theorem states that if p is a prime number, then for any integer a, the number a^p - a is an integer multiple of p. The algorithm for factoring an integer N is to find two integers a and b such that a^2 - Nb^2 = 1. If such integers are found, then N is the product of the two factors a+b and a-b.
